meanings.sent1: The knopped handle was easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The tree had knopped branches that made it look unique.
meanings.sent3: The knopped doorstop kept the door open with style.
meanings.sent4: Her knopped necklace added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: The knopped design on the vase made it stand out in the room.

meanings.definition: To form a knob or protuberance.
meanings.sent1: He knopped the clay into a small figurine.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the tree knopped new growths along its trunk.
meanings.sent3: She carefully knopped the dough to create decorative edges.
meanings.sent4: The artist knopped the sculpture to give it a textured surface.
meanings.sent5: The chef knopped the vegetables for a visually appealing dish.
